hook.text: You didn't choose your parents, your country, your era, or your body. Yet here you are.

buildup.text: Heidegger called this Geworfenheit â€” thrownness. You're thrown into a world you never designed.

discovery.text: You can't start from scratch. Every choice you make happens within constraints you didn't pick.

twist.text: But thrownness isn't an excuse. Existentialists say you're still responsible for what you do with it.

climax.text: You didn't choose the hand you were dealt. You do choose how to play it.

punchline.text: You were thrown into this life. Now it's yours.

quiz.question: What does Heidegger's concept of 'thrownness' describe?
options: Being placed into a world and situation you didn't choose
The act of making deliberate choices
